Column Comment.0: PPDM GROUP IDENTIFIER: Unique ID for the table used to track associationsbetween columns in the data model and logical groupings. For example, you coulduse this table to group all columns that fall in a particular domains, such as depth, orall the columns used by a software application, or the columns used in a particularreport.
Column Comment.1: OWNER OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique number that allows more than oneowner for a group to be listed. Note that this number may also be used for versioning,in conjunction with effective and expiry dates.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: DEFAULT UNIT SYMBOL: In the case where a group represents columns havingcommon measurement domains, the unit of measure that is the default for thatdomain. For example, all depths are in meters.
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date that the association between the column and the groupcame into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.6: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for anorganization of a company or organization.
Column Comment.7: ORGANIZATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique number added to alloworganizations to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.8: GROUP OWNER: The business associate that is the owner of this group of columns.The role that this owner plays should also be clarified.
Column Comment.9: OWNER ROLE: a list of the roles that applications or business associates can play inthe ownership of a group of tables and columns. For example, you may list thebusiness value owner, the technical value owner, the data manager, the generatingapplication, a using application and so on.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: SOFTWARE APPLICATION IDENTIFIER: The identifier for the application that ownsthis alias or code or that is used to apply the data in this row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
